message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: while (eventReader.hasNext()) {
  XMLEvent event = eventReader.nextEvent();
  switch (event.getEventType()) {
    case XMLStreamConstants.START_ELEMENT:
      StartElement startElement = event.asStartElement();
      String qName = startElement.getName().getLocalPart();
      if (qName.equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
        System.out.println("Start Element : comment");
        Iterator<Attribute> attributes = startElement.getAttributes();
        while (attributes.hasNext()) {
          Attribute attribute = attributes.next();
          if (attribute.getName().getLocalPart().equalsIgnoreCase("type")) {
            type = attribute.getValue();
            System.out.println("Type : " + type);
            break;
          }
        }
      } else if (qName.equalsIgnoreCase("text") && type.equals("disease")) {
        text = true;
      }
      break;
    case XMLStreamConstants.CHARACTERS:
      Characters characters = event.asCharacters();
      if (text) {
        res = res + " " + characters.getData();
        text = false;
      }
      break;
    case XMLStreamConstants.END_ELEMENT:
      EndElement endElement = event.asEndElement();
      if (endElement.getName().getLocalPart().equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
        //System.out.println("End Element : comment");
        //System.out.println();
      }
      break;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are only retrieving the first attribute of the "comment" element using attributes.next(). To retrieve the "type" attribute, you need to iterate over all the attributes using a while loop and check if the attribute name is "type". Once you find the "type" attribute, you can get its value.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
XMLInputFactory factory = XMLInputFactory.newInstance();
XMLEventReader eventReader = factory.createXMLEventReader(new FileReader(p));
while (eventReader.hasNext()) {
    XMLEvent event = eventReader.nextEvent();
    switch (event.getEventType()) {
        case XMLStreamConstants.START_ELEMENT:
            StartElement startElement = event.asStartElement();
            String qName = startElement.getName().getLocalPart();
            if (qName.equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
                System.out.println("Start Element : comment");
                Iterator<Attribute> attributes = startElement.getAttributes();
                while (attributes.hasNext()) {
                    Attribute attribute = attributes.next();
                    if (attribute.getName().getLocalPart().equalsIgnoreCase("type")) {
                        type = attribute.getValue();
                        System.out.println("Type: " + type);
                        break;
                    }
                }
            } else if (qName.equalsIgnoreCase("text") && type.equals("disease")) {
                text = true;
            }
            break;
        case XMLStreamConstants.CHARACTERS:
            Characters characters = event.asCharacters();
            if (text) {
                res = res + " " + characters.getData();
                text = false;
            }
            break;
        case XMLStreamConstants.END_ELEMENT:
            EndElement endElement = event.asEndElement();
            if (endElement.getName().getLocalPart().equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
                System.out.println("End Element : comment");
            }
            break;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are only checking the first attribute of the "comment" element. To get the correct value for the "type" attribute, you need to iterate over all the attributes of the "comment" element using a while loop and check each attribute's name. If the attribute's name is "type", then you can get its value.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
XMLInputFactory factory = XMLInputFactory.newInstance();
XMLEventReader eventReader = factory.createXMLEventReader(new FileReader(p));
while (eventReader.hasNext()) {
    XMLEvent event = eventReader.nextEvent();
    switch (event.getEventType()) {
        case XMLStreamConstants.START_ELEMENT:
            StartElement startElement = event.asStartElement();
            String qName = startElement.getName().getLocalPart();
            if (qName.equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
                System.out.println("Start Element : comment");
                Iterator<Attribute> attributes = startElement.getAttributes();
                while (attributes.hasNext()) {
                    Attribute attribute = attributes.next();
                    System.out.println("ATTRIBUTE: " + attribute.getName() + " VALUE: " + attribute.getValue());
                    if (attribute.getName().toString().equals("type") && attribute.getValue().equals("disease")) {
                        type = attribute.getValue();
                        System.out.println("TYPE: " + type);
                    }
                }
            }
            break;
        case XMLStreamConstants.CHARACTERS:
            Characters characters = event.asCharacters();
            if (type.equals("disease")) {
                res = res + " " + characters.getData();
                System.out.println("TEXT: " + res);
            }
            break;
        case XMLStreamConstants.END_ELEMENT:
            EndElement endElement = event.asEndElement();
            if (endElement.getName().getLocalPart().equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
                //System.out.println("End Element : comment");
                //System.out.println();
            }
            break;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you're only checking the first attribute of the "comment" element. To solve this, you need to iterate through all the attributes of the "comment" element using a while loop and check if the attribute name is "type" and the attribute value is "disease". This way, you'll correctly identify the "comment" element with the "type" attribute equal to "disease".

<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are using the `attributes.next()` method only once, which means it will only return the first attribute of the `comment` element. To get the correct attribute value for `type`, you need to iterate through all the attributes of the `comment` element using a while loop and check if the attribute name is equal to "type". If it is, then you can get the attribute value and assign it to the `type` variable.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
XMLInputFactory factory = XMLInputFactory.newInstance();
XMLEventReader eventReader = factory.createXMLEventReader(new FileReader(p));
String type = "";
String res = "";
boolean text = false;

while (eventReader.hasNext()) {
  XMLEvent event = eventReader.nextEvent();
  switch (event.getEventType()) {
    case XMLStreamConstants.START_ELEMENT:
      StartElement startElement = event.asStartElement();
      String qName = startElement.getName().getLocalPart();
      if (qName.equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
        System.out.println("Start Element : comment");
        Iterator<Attribute> attributes = startElement.getAttributes();
        while (attributes.hasNext()) {
          Attribute attribute = attributes.next();
          if (attribute.getName().toString().equalsIgnoreCase("type")) {
            type = attribute.getValue();
            System.out.println("Type: " + type);
          }
        }
      } else if (qName.equalsIgnoreCase("text") && type.equals("disease")) {
        text = true;
      }
      break;
    case XMLStreamConstants.CHARACTERS:
      Characters characters = event.asCharacters();
      if (text) {
        res = res + " " + characters.getData();
        System.out.println("Text: " + res);
        text = false;
      }
      break;
    case XMLStreamConstants.END_ELEMENT:
      EndElement endElement = event.asEndElement();
      if (endElement.getName().getLocalPart().equalsIgnoreCase("comment")) {
        System.out.println("End Element : comment");
        System.out.println();
      }
      break;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are only checking the first attribute in the startElement. To fix this, you need to iterate over all the attributes and check if the attribute name is "type". If it is, then you can get the value of the attribute.

You need to iterate over all the attributes of the element and check if any of them have the name "type". If it does, then you can retrieve its value.
